TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed DataGridViewColumnSortMode extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Defines how a column can be sorted by the user.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each column may have a different sort mode specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn.SortMode%2A> property.
## Examples The following code example illustrates the use of this type. For more information, see [How to: Set the Sort Modes for Columns in the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/set-the-sort-modes-for-columns-wf-datagridview-control.md).
[!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewMisc#066](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewMisc/CS/datagridviewmisc.cs#066)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewMisc#066](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewMisc/VB/datagridviewmisc.vb#066)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnSortMode Automatic = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The user can sort the column by clicking the column header unless the column headers are used for selection. A sorting glyph will be displayed automatically.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnSortMode NotSortable = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The column can only be sorted programmatically, but it is not intended for sorting, so the column header will not include space for a sorting glyph.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnSortMode Programmatic = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The column can only be sorted programmatically, and the column header will include space for a sorting glyph.
